de.lmu.ifi.dbs.elki.database.ids

Interface DBIDRef

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    DBID, DBIDIter, DBIDMIter, DistanceResultPair<D>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DBIDIterAdapter, DoubleDistanceResultPair, EmptyDBIDs.EmptyDBIDIterator, GenericDistanceResultPair, IntegerArrayStaticDBIDs.DBIDItr, IntegerDBID, IntegerDBID.DBIDItr, IntegerDBIDRange.DBIDItr, KNNUtil.DBIDItr, MaskedDBIDs.DBIDItr, MaskedDBIDs.InvDBIDItr, TroveArrayDBIDs.DBIDItr, TroveHashSetModifiableDBIDs.DBIDItr

    public interface DBIDRef
    Some object referencing a DBID. Could be a DBID, a DBIDIter, for example. Important note: do not assume this reference to be stable. Iterators are a good example how the DBIDRef may change.

    • Method Summary

      Compare the current value of two referenced DBIDs.

    • Method Detail

      • getDBID

        DBID getDBID()
        Get the referenced DBID. Efficiency note: this may require materialization of a DBID object.
        Returns:
        referenced DBID

      • getIntegerID

        int getIntegerID()
        Return the integer value of the object ID, if possible.
        Returns:
        integer id

      • hashCode

        @Deprecated
int hashCode()
        Deprecated. Do not use this hash code. Some implementations will not offer stable hash codes!
        WARNING: Hash codes of this interface might not be stable (e.g. for iterators).
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class Object
        Returns:
        current hash code (may change!)

      • equals

        @Deprecated
boolean equals(Object obj)
        Deprecated. 
        WARNING: calling equality on a reference may be an indicator of incorrect usage, as it is not clear whether the programmer meant the references to be the same or the DBIDs.
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
        obj - Object to compare with
        Returns:
        True when they are the same object

      • sameDBID

        boolean sameDBID(DBIDRef other)
        Compare the current value of two referenced DBIDs.
        Parameters:
        other - Other DBID reference (or DBID)
        Returns:
        true when the references currently refer to the same.

      • compareDBID

        int compareDBID(DBIDRef other)
        Compare two objects by the value of the referenced DBID.
        Parameters:
        other - Other DBID or object
        Returns:
        -1, 0 or +1
